FuncDef:
The diameter no-send-ccri without subscription-id command disables a device from sending CCR-I packets to a Diameter server for user login after the device receives a RADIUS authentication response message that does not carry the subscription-id attribute.
The undo diameter no-send-ccri without subscription-id command enables a device to send CCR-I packets to a Diameter server for user login after the device receives a RADIUS authentication response message that does not carry the subscription-id attribute.
By default, a device sends CCR-I packets to a Diameter server for user login, regardless of whether a RADIUS authentication response message received by the device carries the subscription-id attribute.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To disable a device from sending CCR-I packets to a Diameter server for user login after the device receives a RADIUS authentication response message that does not carry the subscription-id attribute, run the diameter no-send-ccri without subscription-id command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
